 • red, purple, blue or white

2. Pulmonary embolism (PE) 
 occurs when part or all of the 
 blood clot breaks free and 
 passes through your blood 
 vessels and reaches your lungs.
 Symptoms:
 • coughing (with blood-stained 
  spit);
 • chest pain;
 • breathlessness or collapse. 
Health professionals use the term 
venous thromboembolism (VTE) 
to cover both types of blood clots.
